CreateSavepointAsync(DbTransaction, string, CancellationToken)

Creates a savepoint within the provided transaction. Savepoints allow portions of a transaction to be rolled back without affecting the entire transaction scope.

Declaration
public Task CreateSavepointAsync(DbTransaction transaction, string name, CancellationToken ct = default)
Parameters
Type Name Description
DbTransaction transaction

The active database transaction.
string name

Name of the savepoint to create.
CancellationToken ct

Token used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task that completes when the savepoint has been created.
Exceptions
Type Condition
InvalidOperationException

Thrown when transaction is null.
ArgumentException

Thrown when name is null or empty.
| Edit this page View Source

CreateTagAsync(string)

Creates a temporal tag entry in the database. Temporal tags can be used to correlate external events with the state of the database at a given time.

Declaration
public Task CreateTagAsync(string tagName)

Entry(object)

Returns the EntityEntry for the supplied entity and ensures that lazy-loading proxies are wired up when supported. The entity is automatically attached to the change tracker in the Unchanged state.

Declaration
public EntityEntry Entry(object entity)
Parameters
Type Name Description
object entity

The entity whose tracking entry is requested.
Returns
Type Description
EntityEntry

An EntityEntry representing the entity's tracking information.
Exceptions
Type Condition

Thrown when entity is null or invalid.

Query(string)

Creates an untyped IQueryable for the specified table name. This API is useful when working with tables or views that do not have a corresponding CLR type at compile time. A dynamic entity type is generated on-demand and cached so subsequent calls incur minimal overhead.

Declaration
public IQueryable Query(string tableName)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string tableName

Name of the table to query.
Returns
Type Description
IQueryable

An IQueryable that can be composed with LINQ operators.
Exceptions
Type Condition
ArgumentException

Thrown when tableName is null or empty.
NormUsageException

Thrown when the provided name contains invalid characters.
| Edit this page View Source

RollbackToSavepointAsync(DbTransaction, string, CancellationToken)

Rolls back the specified transaction to a previously created savepoint.

Declaration
public Task RollbackToSavepointAsync(DbTransaction transaction, string name, CancellationToken ct = default)
Parameters
Type Name Description
DbTransaction transaction

The active database transaction.
string name

Name of the savepoint to roll back to.
CancellationToken ct

Token used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task that completes when the transaction has been rolled back to the savepoint.
Exceptions
Type Condition
InvalidOperationException

Thrown when transaction is null.
ArgumentException

Thrown when name is null or empty.
| Edit this page View Source

SaveChangesAsync(CancellationToken)

Persists all tracked changes to the database. The operation is executed using the configured retry policy which transparently retries transient failures such as deadlocks.

Declaration
public Task<int> SaveChangesAsync(CancellationToken ct = default)
Parameters
Type Name Description
CancellationToken ct

Token used to cancel the asynchronous operation.
Returns
Type Description
Task<int>

The total number of state entries written to the database.
| Edit this page View Source

UseDeadlockResilientSaveChanges()

Configures the context to automatically retry failed SaveChanges operations when the database reports a deadlock (SQL Server error 1205). A default retry policy with exponential backoff is applied.

Declaration
public DbContextOptions UseDeadlockResilientSaveChanges()
Returns
Type Description
DbContextOptions

The current DbContextOptions instance for fluent configuration.
